title: Johor MB: Hire Sabahans instead of foreigners - Nation

persons.name: johor mentri besar datuk seri mohamed khaled nordin

text:
PASIR GUDANG: Sabahans are more than welcome to find employment in Johor as it could potentially reduce dependency on foreign workers in the state.
Johor Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin said the presence of some 13,000 Sabahans in Pasir Gudang was an indication that there were many job opportunities here.
"In a way, Sabahans also contribute to the economic growth in Johor as manufacturers in Pasir Gudang area can hire them," he said.
Khaled said it was better to hire Sabahans instead of foreign workers as a majority of them would make Pasir Gudang their permanent home by raising their families here.
He also said Johor would continue attracting more capital-intensive and high-technology investments into the state as part of its strategy to reduce dependency on foreign workers.
Khaled said if Johor continued to attract labour-intensive investments, more foreigners would be working in the state.
He said it was a fact that manufacturing companies had difficulty hiring locals as factory workers, hence they had to resort to foreign workers.
"We want to produce more semi-skilled and skilled workforce in the Johor, made up not only of Johoreans but also Malaysians from other states," he said at  a press conference after attending the ground breaking ceremony of Pasar Muafakat Sabah @ Johor and Jalan Suria 66, Bandar Seri Alam here on Saturday.
